intro: Hiptage luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon hiptage, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas in mountainous regions. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched.
